About Us – Key Largo, Florida Skip to content Menu Stay Hotels Waterfront Accommodations Wedding Services Getting Here Events Eat Waterfront Seafood Food Festivals Play Dive & Snorkel Fishing Eco-Tours Watersports Arts & Entertainment Dolphin Encounters Shop Calendar of Events Live About Key Largo Professional Services Real Estate and Construction Education Public Utilities Health Care Local Government Local Businesses Calendar of Events Find A Job Tour Keys About Us Resource Center Member Center Chamber Store Member Directory Member Login Menu Stay Hotels Waterfront Accommodations Wedding Services Getting Here Events Eat Waterfront Seafood Food Festivals Play Dive & Snorkel Fishing Eco-Tours Watersports Arts & Entertainment Dolphin Encounters Shop Calendar of Events Live About Key Largo Professional Services Real Estate and Construction Education Public Utilities Health Care Local Government Local Businesses Calendar of Events Find A Job Tour Keys About Us LEGENDARY KEY LARGO CHAMBER OF COMMERCE Legendary Key Largo Chamber of Commerce The Key Largo Chamber of Commerce has been a testament to the dedication and commitment of its members since the late 1930’s when a group of Upper Keys business owners got together to discuss how to improve their business environment. Incorporated in the 1970’s The Upper Keys Chamber of Commerce became the Legendary Key Largo Chamber of Commerce in 1985. Key Largo is a renowned destination and has proven to guarantee an enthusiastic and positive response. Support and Good Business Since its inception, the focus of the Legendary Key Largo Chamber of Commerce has been the promotion of the economy through support of good business, good government and good citizenship. State of Florida Certified Welcome Center Official Visitor Center Key Largo Chamber of Commerce is host to the Florida Keys Visitor Center, which is endorsed by the Monroe County Tourist Development Council and recognized by Visit Florida as a trusted source of information when visiting the Florida Keys. The Florida Keys Visitor Center is located at mile marker 106, one-half mile on the Bayside after you enter Key Largo on U.S. 1.   Look for the official Chamber of Commerce “Welcome Center” and the FDOT blue Visitor sign. The Visitor Center offers information about the entire Florida Keys. Brochures and maps are available for accommodations, attractions,diving and snorkeling, fishing, dining, weddings, nature and ecology tours, shopping, water sports and, of course, there are clean restrooms. At the Visitor Center, you will be introduced to fascinating and informative displays that includes 1700s-era British cannon, one of 13 cannons found in a reef patch offshore of Key Largo.  And coming soon, join us for a Virtual Scuba voyage and interactive exhibitions exploring our Eco-System and the pristine waters sounding the Florida Keys. Daily accommodations and rates are available and there is no commissions or gimmicks; we are pleased to assist with reservations or get information about the center’s participants.  Information about special events is available as well as phone books and newcomer information. The Visitor Center is open Monday-Friday from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., Saturday from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m and Sunday from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m.. Call us at 1-800-822-1088. Our knowledgeable staff has 200 years of Keys’ experience. Let us help you with your Florida Keys plans — whatever they may be. Administrations Guide Board of Directors Board of Directors Meeting Minutes (pdf) Membership Application Meet Our Staff Member Directory Submit an Event Contact the Chamber Working Closely with the Community The Key Largo Chamber of Commerce works closely with all local organizations and institutions to improve the quality of life for all. We interact with government on the local, state and federal levels on issues of importance to the business community. The Key Largo Chamber of Commerce is active in all aspects of community life, and through various projects and committees, our members show they share the Chamber’s commitment to community and business service. The island of Key Largo and the Florida Keys as a whole relies totally on its major industry – tourism. The Chamber promotes the importance of maintaining and enhancing this industry with the knowledge that all businesses in the community benefit from a thriving tourist economy. Every dollar spent by a visitor for accommodations, attractions, dining or shopping filters down to our accountants, attorneys, bankers, contractors, electricians, hairdressers, insurance agents, painters, physicians, veterinarians and on and on. The key to the Chamber’s future success lies in the membership. Let the Chamber know about your business concerns and allow the Chamber to demonstrate how it can serve you. The members define the direction of the Chamber, and your voice needs to be heard. Join us as we endeavor to bring a healthy, happy, successful working environment to the community in which we live, and prosperous future to each and every one. Live – Key Largo, Florida Skip to content Menu Stay Hotels Waterfront Accommodations Wedding Services Getting Here Events Eat Waterfront Seafood Food Festivals Play Dive & Snorkel Fishing Eco-Tours Watersports Arts & Entertainment Dolphin Encounters Shop Calendar of Events Live About Key Largo Professional Services Real Estate and Construction Education Public Utilities Health Care Local Government Local Businesses Calendar of Events Find A Job Tour Keys About Us Resource Center Member Center Chamber Store Member Directory Member Login Menu Stay Hotels Waterfront Accommodations Wedding Services Getting Here Events Eat Waterfront Seafood Food Festivals Play Dive & Snorkel Fishing Eco-Tours Watersports Arts & Entertainment Dolphin Encounters Shop Calendar of Events Live About Key Largo Professional Services Real Estate and Construction Education Public Utilities Health Care Local Government Local Businesses Calendar of Events Find A Job Tour Keys Live LIVE IN KEY LARGO The High Life Key Largo is the first of the fabulous Florida Keys and where many happy residents call home. Relax and live in our friendly and casual island environment surrounded by the beauty of the seas. Want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the mainland but yet still be afforded great schools, health care, parks, restaurants and shopping while maintaining an easy driving distance to the Miami International airport, then Key Largo is for you. Our lifestyle is one of casual grace and we always welcome new neighbors. Come stay for a weekend, week, month or year and you will want to join us. Our Chamber of Commerce has many friendly professional members to assist you in your home search, financing and closing, contact one today. Don’t let another sun set in Key Largo without you here. For a complete list of our members see our member directory. Read more... Welcome to TV88 WHO IS TV88 ?? (305) 587-9830 TV88 is a video Production & Distribution Company. It owns www.MarathonFlorida.com , where it posts the videos it produces. MarathonFlorida.com is an Informational Business & Video Directory of Marathon & the Surrounding Florida Keys. TV88 video productions are shown on The Marathon Florida Show at The Marathon Community Cinema and other venues in town, as well as postings on You Tube, Facebook, and Instagram. TV88 produces recap videos for: – Meet Our Keys Fisheries Neighbors – American Legion Post 154 Historian – Veteran’s Day Parade – Prodigy Dance Studios – The History of the Diving Museum – Monroe Count TSIC – Art Under the Oaks – Pigeon Key – Crane Point – K.A.I.R. Annual Sombrero Beach Run – KCB St. Patrick’s Day Parade – KCB Lighted Boat Parade – KCB’s Kids Fishing Derby – The Annual 7 Mile Bridge Run – The Marathon Community Theatre . . . and many other businesses, organizations, and associations . . . TV88 has many local businesses, associations, and organizations it produces commercials for: – The Tackle Box – Marathon Lumber – Marathon Ale House – Sunrise Studios – Porky’s BBQ – Marathon Yacht Club – Mallory Pinto – Time Out Magazine – Tyrone’s Mobile Car Wash – Coast to Coast Pizza Company – S.S. Wreck & Galley Grill TV88 also uses footage it takes throughout the Middle Keys, and produces local full-length movies, like: – The Marathon Games – Conch Records Music Video Fests – “ Beating the Bus” – “We are Friends of Old Seven” Add or Edit your Listing CLICK HERE Click here to Edit an existing Listing , or to Add a new Listing on MarathonFlorida.com. Your email address WILL NOT be shared or sold to anyone else, and you WILL NOT be put on any other email lists. Thank you for opting in.  You will be happy that you did. Notifications Notifications How far is Marathon Florida from Key West and Key Largo Marathon, Florida is located in the middle of The Florida Keys and is referred to as ‘The Heart of The Florida Keys”. The Islands of Marathon stretch from mile marker 47, which is on the north side of the 7 Mile Bridge , and mile marker 59 in Grassy Key . Mile marker 106 is the first mile marker after crossing the 18 mile stretch at Key Largo and entering the Keys.  Mile marker 0 is located in Key West . Where is Marathon, Florida in The Florida Keys? Marathon, Florida is located in the middle of The Florida Keys.  It is a city spread over Knight's Key, Boot Key, Key Vaca, Fat Deer Key, Long Point Key, Crawl Key and Grassy Key islands in the middle of the Florida Keys.  It is in the County of Monroe in Florida. What’s Happening in Marathon & the Surrounding Florida Keys? Marathon Florida is a City made up of 13 islands located in the middle of The Florida Keys, about 50 miles north of Key West and about 50 miles south of Key Largo. Marathon Florida Keys boasts some of the best boating activities anywhere, including diving, snorkeling, and deep-sea, reef, and flats fishing. Add waterfront restaurants to a list of amenities, and you have a perfect vacation destination. production@MarathonFlorida.com (305) 587-9830 What is it like living in Marathon, Florida Keys? Marathon Florida is situated in Monroe County, in the middle of the Florida Keys, equally between Key Largo and Key West.  Marathon is one of the best places to live or vacation in Florida . Living in Marathon offers residents a dense suburban feel and most residents own their homes. Marathon offers a lot of bars, restaurants, coffee shops and attractions including the Turtle Hospital, Crane Point, The Dolphin Research Center, and the iconic 7 Mile Bridge. The public schools in Marathon are highly rated. Vacation Rentals in Marathon , Florida offer everything one needs for a stress free family get-away. Member Center – Key Largo, Florida Skip to content Menu Stay Hotels Waterfront Accommodations Wedding Services Getting Here Events Eat Waterfront Seafood Food Festivals Play Dive & Snorkel Fishing Eco-Tours Watersports Arts & Entertainment Dolphin Encounters Shop Calendar of Events Live About Key Largo Professional Services Real Estate and Construction Education Public Utilities Health Care Local Government Local Businesses Calendar of Events Find A Job Tour Keys About Us Resource Center Member Center Chamber Store Member Directory Member Login Menu Stay Hotels Waterfront Accommodations Wedding Services Getting Here Events Eat Waterfront Seafood Food Festivals Play Dive & Snorkel Fishing Eco-Tours Watersports Arts & Entertainment Dolphin Encounters Shop Calendar of Events Live About Key Largo Professional Services Real Estate and Construction Education Public Utilities Health Care Local Government Local Businesses Calendar of Events Find A Job Tour Keys Member Center MEMBER CENTER Membership Benefits All members of the Key Largo Chamber of Commerce enjoy the following benefits: Website listing with link to your business and Members Only Portal where you can update weekly, add coupons, post events and job openings, $350 value. Four (4) marketing email blasts per year for all business memberships, $100.00 value. Two (2) marketing email blasts per year for all non-profits, $ 50 value. Your business exposed with a placement in our annual visitor/relocation magazine, 50K in circulation throughout the Keys and the United States. Moreover, 8,000 copies are inserted into the Reporter/Miami Herald and delivered to homes throughout South Florida.  $400 value. Exclusive Member to Member discounts (over 40 participating chamber members), including Office Depot discount card with up to 75% off of printing and other discounts as well. Priceless! Up-to-date Membership mailing information. Recognition as a new member in our monthly newsletter, The Legend, at our luncheons and on the website. Business referrals to Visitors via phone, email, fax and walk-ins to our Visitor Center, as well as, referrals to local and state business owners, and also residents throughout the Florida Keys community and Homestead, Florida. Networking opportunities such as Members in Motion, Cocktails and Conversations, Ribbon Cuttings, Block Parties, Welcome Center Expo and more. Usage of our conference room or an office during regular business hours (no reservations between 11:00 AM – 2:00 PM). Presence at the Tourist Development Council and District Advisory Committee meetings. Representation at the Keys Federation of Chambers, Board of County Commissioners , State and Federal legislation. We use social media for marketing communications, public relations and member/residents engagement. Specifically, we use these Medias to promote our members, promote the Chamber’s events, programs and advocacy; give an insider peek into the Chamber; ask for feedback or interaction; share news about your business as part of your membership. Looking for heightening awareness of your business and enhancing your public profile? Get involved with our committees to build connections, raise your professional profile and affect community change. Take action and become a part of our Marketing & Special Events Committees, Membership / Ambassadors Committee, Education/Workforce or Public Affairs Committee. View Membership Packages Advertising Opportunities Key Largo Visitor Center – photos, rack cards and ChamberVision. Brochure Distribution – your rack cards placed in up to 31 area tourist businesses. Legend – the chamber’s official monthly newsletter. Ads in Visitors Guide and Legend Banner advertising on our website. Resource Guide The resource center contains a guide for Doing Business in the Florida Keys, popular documents produced by the State of Florida and links to popular websites. In addition to the resources listed below the Key Largo Chamber of Commerce is available Monday – Friday from 9:00 – 6:00 at (305)-451-1414 or 24/7 via our contact us form. Reference Guide The Key Largo Chamber of Commerce produced reference guide to starting a business in Monroe County. Head of School Welcome Mission Statement Key Facts Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging Faculty & Staff Directory Campus Map Key Life Key 360° Contact Us Careers at Key Academics Key's rigorous academic program emphasizes experiential learning , interdisciplinary studies and global perspectives while encouraging both collaboration and independent thinking . Academic Philosophy First School Lower School Middle School Upper School Academic Overview Libraries Learning Department Program Key's program is designed to develop independent thinkers , creative innovators , effective collaborators , tenacious problem-solvers , and articulate leaders while cultivating in its students a deep sense of purpose, accountability and intrinsic motivation. Daily Plan-It 1200 4th Street #828 305-731-5780 jill@dailyplan-it.net https://www.dailyplan-it.net Daily Plan-it is a premier special event, incentive travel, and destination management company based in Key West. Celebrated for their creative vision and strong community spirit, they are the masterminds behind Key West's vibrant Artisan Market, held Sundays from 10 AM to 2 PM seasonally from October through April, and the Truman Waterfront Farmers Market, which takes place every Thursday from 2 PM to 7 PM at the Truman Waterfront Park. The team is also responsible for coordinating all activities on the Outer Mole during the thrilling week-long International Powerboat Races in November. Their latest venture, the Just a Few Friends Festival, scheduled for Labor Day weekend, pays homage to Key West’s favorite son, capturing his laid-back lifestyle and musical legacy. With an exceptional talent for curating events that blend artistry and local culture, Daily Plan-it continually enhances the Key West experience. They create a lively atmosphere where residents and visitors unite to celebrate creativity and community. Contact them for your next group adventure, special event, or reward program and discover why they are the heartbeat of Key West's vibrant event scene Key West Attractions Association PO Box 4342 Office Hours: Monday - Friday 9am to 5pm (EST) 305-293-7249 305-294-0900 director@keywestattractions.org https://keywestattractions.org/ Come and take a stroll through historic Old Town and see hundreds of examples of 19th century architecture. For information on joining the Chamber, or if you are considering opening a business visit our website or contact our offices directly. . Planning a vacation to Key West?  They Key West Chamber of Commerce is here to help!   Our visitor center is open seven days a week, were we provide FREE travel planning assistance to the visitors of Key West and the Florida Keys. Great Locations Florida Keys & Key West Area Guidebook PO Box 522647 Marathon, FL 33052 954-943-1188 954-943-1277 info@greatlocations.com http://www.greatlocations.com Great Locations Florida Keys & Key West Area Guidebook is loaded with information about attractions, lodging, dining, shopping, entertainment, water sports, services and transportation. It’s pocket-sized to be used around town, not left in your room. Inside you’ll find our money saving coupon book and the largest area maps of any local guidebook. Florida Keys & Key West Coupon Booklet – Great Locations is the only local tourist publication with a removable coupon booklet. Comprehensive Maps – Great Locations has the largest, most detailed, removable maps covering the Florida Keys, Key Largo, Islamorada, Marathon, Big Pine & the Lower Keys and Key West. Great Locations has the largest circulation of any Florida Keys area guidebook with over 700 distribution points with locations throughout Monroe County and select locations in Broward and Miami-Dade counties. For information on how to advertise with Great Locations in the Florida Keys & Key West contact Cheryl Roll at CRoll@greatlocations.com or call 305-731-0135. DESTINATION Florida Keys & Key West P.O. Box 1233 9am-6pm; Open Daily 305-304-2100 info@DestinationFloridaKeys.com http://destinationfloridakeys.com/ “Live It Like A Local” with DESTINATION Florida Keys & Key West – the Keys’ #1 Visitors Guide and the official in-room travel magazine for the Keys top lodging properties. Created and written by locals, this portable, reader-friendly guide will let you know all about current happenings and give you the real inside scoop on the best places to eat, shop, party and play.  Want to scope out the scene before you get here? Just hit up DESTINATIONFloridaKeys.com where you can check out some of the Keys’ favorite attractions, read “mini-reviews” of restaurants, peruse sample menus, discover great online shopping sites and hook up with the Keys top realtors.  For more info, or to become a new marketing or lodging partner, contact us at 305-304-2100 or email us at info@DestinationFloridaKeys.com .
